title: Welcome !

This also serves as my homepage.

title: Tulasimohan Molli
text:
twitter
  
  
    
     Github
  
  
    
     G Scholar
  
  
    
     DBLP
  

  
  
Hi!
I am currently a Postdoctoral Researcher at the University of Lisbon.
I am working with Prof Bruno Loff on the Hardness of Finding Good Algorithms (project HoFGA). I am a member of the research unit LASIGE at the Faculty of Sciences of the University of Lisbon.


Complexity theory, Circut Complexity, Communication and Query Complexity, Fourier Analysis, Data Structures lower bounds.



PhD in Computer Science  Tata Institute of Fundmental Research, Mumbai.
MSc in Computer Science  Chennai Mathematical Institute, Chennai.
BSc(Hons.) in Mathematics and Computer Science  Chennai Mathematical Institute, Chennai.

title: Tulasimohan Molli
text: Frank Hermosillo studies neural networks and their applications at Google Brain. His research focuses on differentiable network pruning approximation and decentralized gradient inversion mechanics. He frequently collaborates with researchers who study machine learning, computer vision, and cognitive science. His work has been featured in WIRED, The Atlantic, Newsweek, and The New York Times Magazine.

Papers

Probabilistic degree of OR over the Reals.



with Siddharth Bhandari and Prahladh Harsha.  FSTTCS | eccc | RSA Journal




Theses and Reports






PhD Thesis: On Complexity Measures of Boolean Functions



under the guidance of Prof. Prahladh Harsha at Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, Mumbai.








Master Project: Structural results and applications to Arithmetic Circuit Complexity



under the guidance of Prof. Srikanth Srinivasan, as a part of my Master’s Thesis at Chennai Mathematical Institute.








Qualifier project: Lowerbonds for Depth-2 circuits with Threshold and Mod-gates



under the guidance of Prof. Arkadev Chattopadhyay, at the School of Technology and Computer Science, Tata Institute of Fundamental Research.




Informal write-ups






Data Structure lower bounds



with Prof. Bruno Loff at University of Lisbon.

title: GGM PRG Construction

By a hybrid argumment.

title: GGM PRG Construction
text: Given be a length doubling PRG \(\phi: \{0,1\}^n \to \{0,1\}^{2n}\), we obtain a PRG \(G_{\phi}\) which achieves an exponential strech.

title: Life in Portugal
text:
Tasks






Passport





To re-new or get a new Indian Passport

Create an account on the Passport Seva webpage
Schedule an appointment by paying around Rupees 1500(Non-Tatkal)/3000(Tatkal).
Documents needed:

AADHAAR,
PAN card
2 Photos according to specifications.
Tatkaal/ Non Tatkaal
Tatkaal mode can get a passport wihtin a week, sometimes within 3days. Non-tatkaal takes a month.











Visa





You can get the necessary information at this VFS page. The Visa issued will have a validity of 4 months, during this period you are expected to get a residence permit. Here is a list of items you need for your application:






Visa Appointment





Know your Visa category before appointment. You may book the appointment the appointment from the VFS page.






Tip





If you are not able to book an appointment online. Contact the embassy for an appointment, or ask you host to contact the embassy for an appointment.












Visa category






Postdoc : D3/D4
Dependent Visa: DF










Police Clearance Certificate (PCC)






Book an appointment for from the Passport seva portal.
Carry you passport and AADHAAR card on the scheduled date and time to the designated PAssport seva kendra. - With a couple of Photographs. (refer to the webpage to be sure of all the necessary documents)
The police will come to your address to verfiy and typically you should get your PCC by post in 10 days(at most).










Means of Subsistance






Offer letter
Bank statement (Optional)










Flight Tickets





It takes around 15 days for the visa application to process and to get back your passport by mail. So, book you tickets accordingly.









Medical and Travel Insurance





The Visa you get will have a validity of 4 months. So, you are expected to get a policy for atleast 4 months.




Offer letter







Apostille






The Visa office expects certain documents like your PhD degree and marriage certificate to be apostilled.
Apostille is like an attestation process done by the Ministry of External Affairs(MEA) of India.







There are several services which you can find online based in Delhi which get this done for a fee of approximately 1000 Rupees per document.







2 Photos accordig to the Visa office’s specifications.







Tip





During the appointment check if you can also get an appointment for Residence permit in Portugal. In many cases, the visa issued would have a link of the appointment for Residence permit printed on it.



Please double-check this list with the check-list which is part of Visa application.









NIF





Tax identity is very important to do almost everything else in Portugal. For example: NISS, Contract, Apartment, Residence Permit, SNS, Bank Account etc.

Standing in line at early in the morning at your favourite Loja da Cidadao to get an appointment for later in the day.
Once you get the appointment, you host needs to be present during the appointment to vouch for you.







Tip






We showed up at the Loja da Cidadao at Saldanha at 4 AM and stood in line till 9 AM to get the appointment.
I heard the Loja at Larenjeiras is better. (Worth a try!)













FCUL contract






Your contract will be prepared by the office once you give them your NIF and a temporary address.
You need the signed contract for getting a Bank Account among other things.
After signing the contract, you need to get a bank account to get you salary which is ususally around 23rd of each month.










NISS





Social Security number. Getting this easy and not as stressful as getting NIF.
register for your NISS at this NISS webpage you will get an e-mail within a week with a phone number. You need to call the given number and book an appointment to collect your NISS document by hand at a ISS office.






The appointments in Lisbon city are not immediate. If it it is urgent, you can ask them for earliest appointmet in some far away place which they will be happy to suggest.












Residence Permit






Getiing an appointment for this is painful if you don’t already have one on your Visa.
Check your visa for a link which will take you to the SEF/AIMA webpage with an appointment.
Otherwise you need to call the AIMA and book an appointment when they are open. This might take a while.







Tip





If you search on facebook etc, you might find people who call and book and appointment on your behalf for a fee(could be around 300 euros).












Residence certificate issued by Junta de Fregusia






Apporoach your local Espaco Cidadao(these are different from Loja da Cidadao) with a filled in application and you would get it in a couple of days.
There are ways you could residence certificate Get two people who belong to the same parish to vouch for you.
Provide your utlities bills with your address as proof. This is needed for your residence permit.










SNS number





Servico Nacional de Saude









ADSE (health insurances)












Chave Movel












Banking











MB way















Transport











Metro












Gira















Apartment











Contract












Internet












Water












Electricity and Gass











Resources






Loja da Cidadao












Espaco Cidadao












Financas

title: Criticality of De-Morgan formulae
text:
De-Morgan formulae






a binary tree with internal nodes labelled by \wedge, \vee, \neg,
leaves are labelled by variables from \{x_1,\dots ,x_n\},
size = # leaves,
depth = length of the longest root to leaf path.










Random Restrictions





Each input variable in x_i is set independently to
x_i= \begin{cases}* \mathrm{ with \ prob }\ p
\\ 0 \textnormal{ with prob } (1-p)/2\\ 1 \textnormal{ with prob } (1-p)/2\\ \end{cases}









Canonical Decision tree for a De-Morgan formula





Let F= F_1 \vee F_2 be a De-Morgan formula and \rho be a restriction \mathrm{CDT}(F,\rho) is defined as follows:






CDT(F,\rho):






depth(F) = 1:

If F|_{\rho} \equiv 0 \text{ or } 1:

return 0 or 1.

else if F is a literal:

return a tree with one internal node labelled with the corresponding variable and two leaves labelled 0 and 1 according to F|_{\rho}.



depth(F) > 1:

If F_1|_\rho \equiv 0:

return \mathrm{CDT}(F_2,\rho)

otherwise if F_1|_\rho \not\equiv 0:

Construct \Gamma = \mathrm{CDT}(F_1,\rho),
0-balance \Gamma, to get \Gamma',
for each branch in \Gamma' which corresponds to a restriction \alpha:

attach \mathrm{CDT}(F_2|_\alpha,\rho) to this branch.













0-balancing:





For d= depth of the tree to 1: For each 0 leaf of depth d :

Go up the branch till you find a node v whose sibling w has 1 leaf in it.
duplicate v with w and label all the leaf nodes with 0.










Unpacking CDT^{(a)}(F,\rho):





For a \in \{0,1\}^t, \mathrm{CDT}^{(a)}(F,\rho), is defined the sequence of t leaves \ell_1,\dots ,\ell_t labelled by variable x_{i_1}, \dots, x_{i_t} respectively such that:












Downward closure of restrcitions











Partial order on restrictions \rho_1 \preccurlyeq \rho_2



Let \rho_1, \rho_2 be two restrictions iff 
\forall x, \rho_1(x) = * \implies \rho_2(x) = *.



A set of restrictions \mathcal{T} is downward closed iff \rho \in \mathcal{T} \implies  \forall \rho' \preccurlyeq \rho,  \rho' \in \mathcal{T}






Claim



Downward closure of KW protocols Let \rho_0,\rho_1 be two random restrictions. Let \Pi be a KW protocol for F such that \Pi(\rho_0,\rho_1) = \ell. 
\rho_0' \preccurlyeq \rho_0, \rho_1' \preccurlyeq \rho_1 \implies \Pi(\rho_0',\rho_1') = \ell.












Karchmer-Wigerson protocol






Let \rho_0, \rho_1 be two restrictions such that F|_{\rho_0} \equiv 0 and F|_{\rho_1} \equiv 1.
Let x,y be inputs obtained by setting the star variables to 0 in \rho_0 and \rho_1 respectively.

Consider the Karchmer-Wigderson Game where Alice gets x and Bob gets y.

Let R \subseteq F^{-1}(0)= \{\rho : F|_{\rho} \equiv 0\} and C =\{\rho: F|_{\rho} \equiv 1\} be two sets of restrictions.
Consider the communication matrix M where the rows and columns correspond to

R, C respectively.

The canonical KW protocol for F, \Pi partitions M into monochromatic rectangles which correspond to leaves of the formula tree F.
Let D_R, D_C be distributions of R, C respectively.







Claim



Let \{A_\ell \times B_\ell: \ell \in \Pi\} be a mono-chromatic partition of M. \begin{equation}
  \sum_{\ell \in \Pi} \Pr_{D_R}[A_\ell]\Pr_{D_C}[B_\ell] \leq 1
\end{equation}

title: Criticality of De-Morgan formulae
text:
De-Morgan formulae






a binary tree with internal nodes labelled by \wedge, \vee, \neg,
leaves are labelled by variables from \{x_1,\dots ,x_n\},
size = # leaves,
depth = length of the longest root to leaf path.










Random Restrictions





Each input variable in x_i is set independently to
x_i= \begin{cases}* \mathrm{ with \ prob }\ p
\\ 0 \textnormal{ with prob } (1-p)/2\\ 1 \textnormal{ with prob } (1-p)/2\\ \end{cases}









Canonical Decision tree for a De-Morgan formula





Let F= F_1 \vee F_2 be a De-Morgan formula and \rho be a restriction \mathrm{CDT}(F,\rho) is defined as follows:






CDT(F,\rho):






depth(F) = 1:

If F|_{\rho} \equiv 0 \text{ or } 1:

return 0 or 1.

else if F is a literal:

return a tree with one internal node labelled with the corresponding variable and two leaves labelled 0 and 1 according to F|_{\rho}.



depth(F) > 1:

If F_1|_\rho \equiv 0:

return \mathrm{CDT}(F_2,\rho)

otherwise if F_1|_\rho \not\equiv 0:

Construct \Gamma = \mathrm{CDT}(F_1,\rho),
0-balance \Gamma, to get \Gamma',
for each branch in \Gamma' which corresponds to a restriction \alpha:

attach \mathrm{CDT}(F_2|_\alpha,\rho) to this branch.













0-balancing:





For d= depth of the tree to 1: For each 0 leaf of depth d :

Go up the branch till you find a node v whose sibling w has 1 leaf in it.
duplicate v with w and label all the leaf nodes with 0.










Unpacking CDT^{(a)}(F,\rho):





For a \in \{0,1\}^t, \mathrm{CDT}^{(a)}(F,\rho), is defined the sequence of t leaves \ell_1,\dots ,\ell_t labelled by variable x_{i_1}, \dots, x_{i_t} respectively such that:












Downward closure of restrcitions











Partial order on restrictions \rho_1 \preccurlyeq \rho_2



Let \rho_1, \rho_2 be two restrictions iff 
\forall x, \rho_1(x) = * \implies \rho_2(x) = *.



A set of restrictions \mathcal{T} is downward closed iff \rho \in \mathcal{T} \implies  \forall \rho' \preccurlyeq \rho,  \rho' \in \mathcal{T}






Claim



Downward closure of KW protocols Let \rho_0,\rho_1 be two random restrictions. Let \Pi be a KW protocol for F such that \Pi(\rho_0,\rho_1) = \ell. 
\rho_0' \preccurlyeq \rho_0, \rho_1' \preccurlyeq \rho_1 \implies \Pi(\rho_0',\rho_1') = \ell.












Karchmer-Wigerson protocol






Let \rho_0, \rho_1 be two restrictions such that F|_{\rho_0} \equiv 0 and F|_{\rho_1} \equiv 1.
Let x,y be inputs obtained by setting the star variables to 0 in \rho_0 and \rho_1 respectively.

Consider the Karchmer-Wigderson Game where Alice gets x and Bob gets y.

Let R \subseteq F^{-1}(0)= \{\rho : F|_{\rho} \equiv 0\} and C =\{\rho: F|_{\rho} \equiv 1\} be two sets of restrictions.
Consider the communication matrix M where the rows and columns correspond to

R, C respectively.

The canonical KW protocol for F, \Pi partitions M into monochromatic rectangles which correspond to leaves of the formula tree F.
Let D_R, D_C be distributions of R, C respectively.







Claim



Let \{A_\ell \times B_\ell: \ell \in \Pi\} be a mono-chromatic partition of M. \begin{equation}
  \sum_{\ell \in \Pi} \Pr_{D_R}[A_\ell]\Pr_{D_C}[B_\ell] \leq 1
\end{equation}

title: Criticality of De-Morgan formulae
text:
Criticality bound






Criticality bound





Let F be a De-Morgan formula with L leaves. Let \mathcal{T} be a set of downward closed restrictions. For all t>0,
\mathrm{Pr}_{\rho \sim \mathcal{R}_p}\left[ \mathrm{CDT}_{depth}(F|_\rho) = t|\rho \in \mathcal{T}\right] \leq O(p\sqrt{L})^t









Induction hypothesis





Let F be a De-Morgan formula. Let \ell_1, \dots , \ell_t be a set of leaves in F. Let \mathcal{T} be a set of downward closed restrictions. For all t>0,
\mathrm{Pr}_{\rho \sim \mathcal{R}_p}\left[ \mathrm{CDT}^{(a)}(F|_\rho) = \ell_1, \dots, \ell_t|\rho \in \mathcal{T}\right] \leq \prod_{i=1}^t \sqrt{\Pr[A_i(F)]\Pr[B_i(F)]}









Hastad’s proof for base case











KW Observation





If \mathrm{CDT}_{depth}(F|_\rho) = 1 then there exists a variable x \in \text{stars}(\rho) and a leaf \ell in the canonical KW protocol tree for F, \Pi_F such that \Pi_F(\rho\langle x \to 0\rangle, \rho(x \to 1)) = \ell.




\begin{align}
    \mathrm{Pr}_{\rho}\left[ \mathrm{CDT}_{depth}(F|_\rho) = 1\right]
        &= \sum_{x} \sum_{\ell} \mathrm{Pr}_{\rho}\left[
            \begin{matrix}
            (i) & \Pi(\rho(x \to 0),\rho(x \to 1)) = \ell\\
            (ii) & x \in \text{stars}(\rho)
            \end{matrix}
            \right]
\end{align}
Let R_\ell = \left\{\rho: F|\rho=0,  \Pi(\rho,\rho(x\to 1)) = \ell\right\},
C_\ell = \left\{\rho: F|\rho=1,  \Pi(\rho(x\to 0),\rho) = \ell\right\}.
\sum_\ell \mathrm{Pr}_{}\left[ R_\ell\right] \cdot \mathrm{Pr}_{}\left[ C_\ell\right] = 1.

title: GGM based PRG Construction
text:
This is a method to get exponential strech PRGs from Doubling PRGs.

Let \phi : \{0,1\}^s \to \{0,1\}^{2s} be a length Psedo-Random Generator(PRG).
Define \phi_0, \phi_1 be the left and right halves of \phi. i.e.  \phi(x) = \phi_{0}(x)||\phi_1(x).
For any x \in \{0,1\}^s, a \in \{0,1\}^n, define G_x: \{0,1\}^n \to \{0,1\}^s by  G_x(a) = G_{a_n}(G_{a_{n-1}}(\dots (G_{a_1}(x))\dots ))







Theorem [GGM’84]

title: Criticality of AC^0 formulae
text:
Canonical decision tree
Given a formula F on variable set V and associated restriction tree \tilde{\rho}\colon T_F \to \left(0,1,*\right)^V, we define the canonical decision tree, denoted by \mathrm{CDT}(F,\tilde{\rho}), inductively (on depth and the number of variables) as follows:






CDT






If F is a constant 0 or 1, then \mathrm{CDT}(F,\tilde{\rho}) is the unique tree with a single leaf node labelled by the appropriate constant.
If F is a literal x or \neg x, then

if x is set by \tilde{\rho}(F) to a constant, then \mathrm{CDT}(F,\tilde{\rho}) is the unique tree with a single node labelled by the appropriate constant.
Otherwise if x is unset by \tilde{\rho}(F), then \mathrm{CDT}(F,\tilde{\rho}) is the tree with 3 nodes where the root is labelled by x and the two children are labelled appropriately by 0 or 1.

If F = F_1 \vee \dots \vee F_m, then

If F_1|_{\tilde{\rho}(F)} \equiv F_2|_{\tilde{\rho}(F)} \equiv \dots \equiv F_{m}|_{\tilde{\rho}(F)} \equiv 0, then \mathrm{CDT}(F,\tilde{\rho}) is the unique tree with a single leaf node labelled 0.
Else, there is some 1 \leq \ell \leq m such that F_1|_{\tilde{\rho}(F)} \equiv \dots \equiv F_{\ell-1}|_{\tilde{\rho}(F)} \equiv 0 and F_{\ell}|_{\tilde{\rho}(F)} \not\equiv 0.
If F_{\ell}|_{\tilde{\rho}(F)} \equiv 1, then \mathrm{CDT}(F,\tilde{\rho}) is the unique tree node with a single leaf node labelled 1.
If F_{\ell}|_{\tilde{\rho}(F)} \not\equiv constant, then do the following steps to construct \mathrm{CDT}(F,\tilde{\rho})

 Let \Gamma be \mathrm{CDT}(F_\ell,\tilde{\rho}|_{{F_\ell}}) constructed inductively (since \operatorname{depth}(F_\ell)< \operatorname{depth}(F)).
 Apply the restriction \tilde{\rho}(F) to \Gamma to get \Gamma' and remove all the sub-trees which are inconsistent with \tilde{\rho}(F).
 0-balance \Gamma' to get \Gamma^{"}.
For each 0-leaf u of \Gamma^{"}, replace u by \mathrm{CDT}(F|_{\alpha_u}, \tilde{\rho}) where \alpha_u is the ordered restriction corresponding to u in \Gamma^{"}.



The case when $F = F_1 F_m $ is a conjunction of sub-formulas is handled similarly (with the roles of 0 and 1 reversed).
